title: Tools and Automation Engineer
description: SummaryPosted: Jan 24, 2025Role Number:200588109Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming excellent products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job, and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The Applications team is looking for a technical contributor to drive and deliver test automation systems and tooling that can scale across teams and feature sets at continuous integration speeds. You‚Äôll be joining a highly skilled team of engineers who collaborate internally and cross-organizationally, bridging disciplines in order to construct innovative solutions.DescriptionIn this role, you will be responsible for planning, designing, maintaining, and executing test cases with minimal direction, based on specification documents and access to databases. Your ability to stand up and execute a wide breadth of tests with scripts and tools will be paramount. Your ability to report bugs with impeccable isolation and regression techniques will be the key to your success. You will be required to juggle a wide variety of deliverables that will rely on your talent for managing priorities and communicating progress and risk effectively and systematically. Your ongoing curiosity and commitment to self-education in the field of well-being as well as new testing techniques is what will set you apart. You will be working closely with other team members to help coordinate cross-functional test efforts. You will be in continual dialogue with Engineering and Design as products evolve, and you will need to have empathy for users so you can effectively advocate on their behalf. The ability to streamline processes for data collection and systematically parse large data sets will be a huge plus.  You will also ensure the successful delivery of a quality product by performing ad-hoc and structured tests.Minimum QualificationsA minimum of 2 years of industry experience performing tools and automation engineering.Bachelor‚Äôs degree required in computer science, engineering, or a similar academic field.Proficient in one or more compiled languages: e.g. Swift, Objective-C, Java, C++.Proficient in one or more scripting languages (system automations / web development): e.g. Python, Go, Scala, JavaScript, Bash.Experience with test frameworks such as JUnit, XCTest, XCUI.Familiar with SDLC practices (Agile vs. Waterfall, SCM, issue tracking).Computer Science fundamentals (object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, and complexity analysis).Strong problem-solving skills and ability to identify opportunities for technical improvement.Comfortable with *nix commands and shell scripting environments.Excellent communication skills to collaborate across teams.Preferred QualificationsExperience bringing a software project from technical spec to production.Experience with DevOps (CI, CD, automation strategies, etc.).Data Science and ML expertise.Background in mental and physical health-related fields.Pay & BenefitsAt Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $129,600 and $236,300, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple‚Äôs discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple‚Äôs Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You‚Äôll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses ‚Äî including tuition. Tools and Automation Engineer

San Diego, California, United States

Full Time Mid-level / Intermediate USD 129K - 236K

Apple

We‚Äôre a diverse collective of thinkers and doers, continually reimagining what‚Äôs possible to help us all do what we love in new ways.

View all jobs at Apple

Apply now Apply later

Posted 6 hours ago

Summary

Posted: Jan 24, 2025

Role Number:200588109

Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming excellent products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job, and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The Applications team is looking for a technical contributor to drive and deliver test automation systems and tooling that can scale across teams and feature sets at continuous integration speeds. You‚Äôll be joining a highly skilled team of engineers who collaborate internally and cross-organizationally, bridging disciplines in order to construct innovative solutions.

Description


In this role, you will be responsible for planning, designing, maintaining, and executing test cases with minimal direction, based on specification documents and access to databases. Your ability to stand up and execute a wide breadth of tests with scripts and tools will be paramount. Your ability to report bugs with impeccable isolation and regression techniques will be the key to your success. You will be required to juggle a wide variety of deliverables that will rely on your talent for managing priorities and communicating progress and risk effectively and systematically. Your ongoing curiosity and commitment to self-education in the field of well-being as well as new testing techniques is what will set you apart. You will be working closely with other team members to help coordinate cross-functional test efforts. You will be in continual dialogue with Engineering and Design as products evolve, and you will need to have empathy for users so you can effectively advocate on their behalf. The ability to streamline processes for data collection and systematically parse large data sets will be a huge plus. You will also ensure the successful delivery of a quality product by performing ad-hoc and structured tests.

Minimum Qualifications


  • A minimum of 2 years of industry experience performing tools and automation engineering.
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree required in computer science, engineering, or a similar academic field.
  • Proficient in one or more compiled languages: e.g. Swift, Objective-C, Java, C++.
  • Proficient in one or more scripting languages (system automations / web development): e.g. Python, Go, Scala, JavaScript, Bash.
  • Experience with test frameworks such as JUnit, XCTest, XCUI.
  • Familiar with SDLC practices (Agile vs. Waterfall, SCM, issue tracking).
  • Computer Science fundamentals (object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, and complexity analysis).
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to identify opportunities for technical improvement.
  • Comfortable with *nix commands and shell scripting environments.
  • Excellent communication skills to collaborate across teams.


Preferred Qualifications


  • Experience bringing a software project from technical spec to production.
  • Experience with DevOps (CI, CD, automation strategies, etc.).
  • Data Science and ML expertise.
  • Background in mental and physical health-related fields.


Pay & Benefits


  • At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $129,600 and $236,300, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

    Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple‚Äôs discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple‚Äôs Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You‚Äôll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses ‚Äî including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

    Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.



  • Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about your EEO rights as an applicant.
